debugText:
**Location:** Liverpool, NSW, with 3 days a week in the office and 2 days remote.

**Compensation:** $450-$600 per day including super, depending on experience.

**Duration:** 6-month contract with potential for extension.

**Level:** Junior to Mid-Level Engineer

**Key Technologies:** .NET, SQL, Visual Studio, C+, VB, ASP Classic, Custom Web Applications.

**Company Overview**

Join a global leader operating at the forefront of innovation, providing essential technology solutions across various industries. With a strong presence worldwide, this organisation is continuously advancing in delivering high-tech systems.

**Role Description**

We are looking for a Junior to Mid-Level IT Systems Analyst/Programmer to join my client. In this role, you will work closely with local business stakeholders and liaise with HQ to deliver digital solutions that meet business needs. You’ll be involved in the development, support, and maintenance of web-based applications, working with technologies such as .NET, SQL, Visual Studio, VB, C+, and more. Your duties will include:

- Liaising with internal stakeholders and external vendors to analyse and define business requirements.
- Designing, developing, and testing custom-built applications, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
- Providing technical support and troubleshooting for custom applications, ensuring quick resolution of issues.
- Documenting system architecture and development processes to ensure ease of support and knowledge sharing.
- Ensuring that best practices are followed and HQ guidelines are adhered to.
- Supporting project timelines and coordinating task delivery with vendors and business users.
- Conducting key user training to ensure smooth adoption and usage of developed applications.

**Ideal Candidate**

- 2-3 years of experience as a software developer, working on custom-built applications.
- Strong understanding of business processes and experience in translating business needs into technical solutions.
- Proficiency in .NET, SQL, Visual Studio, VB, C+, and ASP Classic.
- Ability to communicate effectively across different functional teams and with external vendors.
- A fast learner with a collaborative mindset and a strong customer-service orientation.
- Experience in troubleshooting, unit testing, and user acceptance testing.

**How to Apply**

If you’re excited by this opportunity, please apply through the advertisement or reach out directly to Tim at tim@sustainrecruit.com. All discussions will remain confidential.

Karlka Recruiting Group has partnered with a
**State Government Agency**

- Design, develop, and deploy integration solutions on AWS platform, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design integration solutions that align with business objectives.
- Build cloud-native REST and HTTP APIs using services such as Amazon API Gateway, AWS Lambda, and AWS messaging services – SNS, SQS, EventBridge.

debugText:
**Join Our Team as a Senior Embedded Software Engineer!**

**Location:** St Marys

**Position:** Permanent Full-Time – Start ASAP

**Pay:** Competitive Salary

We are currently seeking a passionate Automotive Embedded Software Engineer with a drive for zero-emission vehicles and cutting-edge technology. This role offers the opportunity to apply your technical creativity to develop custom embedded solutions for advanced applications such as charge controllers, DC-DC converters, multiplex systems, and electric vehicle control.

**About Us:**

Based in Sydney %%U+0027%% s Western Suburbs, Custom Denning is leading the charge in locally manufactured electric vehicles. We’re working closely with the NSW government to transition buses to an electric fleet by 2030, contributing to a cleaner, zero-emission future.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- Develop embedded software for both prototyping and volume manufacturing.
- Assist in the selection of suppliers for high-voltage electric vehicle components.
- Capture and specify detailed software requirements.
- Design and analyze software architecture, focusing on hardware-software interfaces.
- Utilize auto-generated software tools like MATLAB/Simulink for software design.
- Conduct Model-in-the-Loop (MIL), Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL), and Software-in-the-Loop (SIL) testing and validation of control strategies developed in Simulink.
- Evaluate third-party software components and tools, using evaluation boards for prototyping.
- Apply knowledge of the software development lifecycle (e.g., V-life cycle) to all phases, including requirements capture, architecture development, software design, implementation, and testing.
- Diagnose vehicle faults and optimize system performance.
- Work with communication interfaces such as CAN and LIN.
- Mentor junior engineers and provide technical guidance as needed.

**Essential Experience:**

- 5+ years of embedded software development (automotive experience preferred).
- Proven experience with auto-generated software tools (MATLAB/Simulink).
- Experience in control strategies, simulation testing, and validation processes.
- Strong knowledge of communications interfaces (CAN, LIN).
- Effective verbal and written communication skills and strong time management.
- Ability to work collaboratively and mentor other team members.

**Desirable Skills:**

- Expertise in CAN communication and diagnostic protocols (CCP, J1939, UDS, OBDII).
- Familiarity with vehicle development and calibration tools (e.g., CANalyzer, CANape).
- Experience launching software into production.
- Knowledge of vehicle energy optimization, system simulation, and dynamics control.
- Understanding of functional safety systems (ISO 26262, IEC 61508).

**General Requirements:**

- Bachelor’s degree in Engineering.
- Strong analytical, problem-solving, and listening skills.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
- Ability to multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

**What We Offer:**

- Secure, permanent roles with career growth opportunities.
- Employee Assistance Program for you and your family.
- Referral Program.

**Ready to Join Us?**

If this sounds like you, apply now for a detailed discussion about the role. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Join a leading Australian SaaS provider in the document automation space, with a strong presence in the Australian legal industry.

Seeking an experienced Full-stack Senior Angular, Python Engineer to join our dynamic development team. Your expertise will drive the creation of scalable, efficient, and secure software solutions that meet the evolving needs of our clients.

**Responsibilities:**

- Develop and maintain efficient and reliable web applications and RESTful APIs using Python and relevant frameworks (e.g., Django, Flask).
- Design, develop, and optimize SQL database schemas and queries to ensure high-performance data retrieval and manipulation.
- Utilize object-relational mapping (ORM) tools like SQLAlchemy for database access.
- Implement secure authentication and authorization mechanisms to protect backend APIs using cloud services such as AWS Cognito or similar.
- Integrate with third-party systems and services to enable seamless data exchange.
- Collaborate with frontend developers to integrate backend functionality with Angular-based user interfaces.

**Experience:**

- Proven experience as a Backend Software Developer, with at least 5 years of experience.
- Experienced in developing front-end using Angular.
- Strong proficiency in Python and experience with web frameworks such as Django or Flask.
- Extensive knowledge of RESTful API development and principles.
- Solid understanding of SQL databases and proficiency in writing efficient queries.
- Proficiency in cloud services (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) including serverless functions and managed databases.
- Strong understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar.
- Familiarity with frontend technologies, particularly Angular, and ability to collaborate with frontend developers.
- Experience with source control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies.
- Strong problem-solving and debugging skills.
- Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
- Ability to mentor and provide technical guidance to junior team members.
- Must be a team player and work together with the team to achieve the business goals.

debugText:
Are you ready to shape the future of infrastructure that enables critical national payments infrastructure at the Reserve Bank?

The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) is looking to hire an Enterprise Program Architect for the Core Modernisation Program. The Core Modernisation Program includes a complete re-architecture and rebuild of the Bank %%U+0027%% s primary data centres and underlying technologies, establishing a next generation foundation to meet the requirements for generations to come. The program includes establishment of the new infrastructure, including the replacement of one of the Bank %%U+0027%% s primary data centres with a new co-located data centre, migration of all of the Bank %%U+0027%% s systems to the new infrastructure across two data centres, and the decommissioning of the existing head office data centre. This role is a fixed term contract until June 2027 based at Baulkham Hills.

In addition to participating in the design aspects of the infrastructure and migration, the role will drive alignment across program, technology, and business stakeholders ensuring performance, resilience, availability, and security requirements are met in the target state. This role is part of a team that provides IT strategy and architecture services to the Bank. We work directly with IT and Business teams to ensure our technology investments are aligned with the Bank %%U+0027%% s strategy and plans.

You %%U+0027%% ll bring with you a strategic mindset, strong forward thinking, and the ability to maintain alignment to the agreed target state across program and technical staff.

We are looking for an **Enterprise Architect** who:

- Leads the development of target state strategies and technology plans for the Core Modernisation Program, working closely with Enterprise and Principal Infra Architects, Senior Program and Business stakeholders, and Partners/vendors to ensure performance, resilience, availability, and security requirements are met.
- Leads analysis work and identification of changes needed in the Bank %%U+0027%% s IT target state operating model.
- Proven ability to work with project and technical staff to identify and negotiate opportunities for improvement within the constraints of a project that has strict delivery timeframes.
- Can lead the development of architectures for complex domains/solutions and plan and govern against these, including active participation in Design and Architectural governance forums.
- Has the ability to lead, develop and motivate a practice area or project of IT specialists who exercise independence in their work.
- Will identify and highlight potential delivery and delivered risks/impacts that need to be mitigated throughout the project before transition into BAU.
- Provides senior technical leadership to the IT department, including expertise in infrastructure, data, applications, security technologies and their deployment.
- Helps to set technology standards, advise on their application, and ensure compliance.

**Key skills and experience** required for the role:

- In-depth knowledge and experience in roadmap, strategy, and target state design development for complex data centre migrations.
- Sound understanding of enterprise infrastructure (e.g. Virtualisation, Networking, Storage) relevant to on premise datacentres, with knowledge/experience with cloud-based alternatives and SaaS based supporting technologies (such as Observability platforms).
- Experience in resolving solution design and architecture contentions with stakeholders in a timely way through governance channels.
- Excellent Stakeholder Engagement skills and experience in representing the department across the Bank or similar organizations.
- Has experience working with integration partners/vendors in large programs of work.
- Qualifications relevant to the Bank or IT industry, including TOGAF, and technical domain certifications.

**Be More**

The RBA makes an important contribution to the Australian economy through the pursuit of national economic policy objectives and associated activities in financial markets and banking. We also issue Australia %%U+0027%% s banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contribute to the welfare of the Australian people.

Made up of specialists across a wide range of fields, our people have a meaningful role to play in achieving these objectives. Our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry, and we treat one another with respect while promoting the public interest through our efforts.

We know it is the growth and success of our people that drives the Bank forward. Come and make a bigger contribution while you build and develop your own skills too, because being more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia.

**The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to crafting a diverse and inclusive environment and encourage applications from expert candidates seeking workplace flexibility.**

Companion Systems is a growing Australian software company. For the past two decades we have been developing, marketing, and supporting software for the Australian and New Zealand residential construction industry. We believe in the strength of in-person collaboration, where we can foster a friendly working environment, and encourage self-growth and career development. Our office is located close to public transport and many great cafés and restaurants in the Parramatta CBD.

## About The Role

This is a full-time Graduate position working in .NET. You will be working in an agile environment as part of a scrum team maintaining existing code and developing new products.

## About You

Requirements:

- **Be an Australian Citizen/Permanent resident**
- Completed a Computer Science, or equivalent, qualification
- Knowledge in Object-Oriented Programming languages

Having exposure to, or experience with, any of the following will be advantageous:

- EF Core and either .NET Framework or .NET Core, or equivalent in other languages
- Blazor, C# and SQL
- API development

- Agile methodologies

debugText:
- **Computer System Officer - Level 5**
- **Temporary Full-Time up to June 2026**
- **Sydney Olympic Park and Parramatta**

**About us**

The NSW Police Force (NSWPF) is one of the largest police forces in the western world, with more than 20,000 employees, including more than 4,000 administrative employees who support the sworn officers that provide a range of law and order services 24 hours a day, seven days a week to the socially, geographically and culturally diverse community of NSW.

**About the role**

We have an opportunity for a
**Solution Architect** to be part of our Enterprise Architecture and
Strategy, Technology and Communication Services Command team. The Solution Architect is responsible for the development of the technology solutions and mapping the business requirements to systems/technical requirements to ensure they are in line with the enterprise architectural plan.

For more information on this role (e.g. essential requirements, key accountabilities and capabilities required for the role), **[click here](https://files.jobs.nsw.gov.au/rdxsoc)** to view the role description.

**To be successful in this role, you will have:**

- At least a minimum of 5+ years’ experience in defining applications solutions architecture and design, integrations, infrastructure and cloud architectures, such as AWS, Azure, and/or Google cloud and hybrid services.
- Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of TOGAF (certification in TOGAF or equivalent).
- Experience in the following technologies/frameworks.
- Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Digital technology and development; and Service Orientated Architecture (SOA).
- Experience as a solutions architect including exposure to projects of $10Mil+, with prior experience working on large scale projects within the government sector highly desirable.
- Experience in transformation programs such as data centre refresh and/or migration to cloud.
- Integration architecture experience including iPaaS, API Gateways, ETL, ESB and related technologies (e.g., REST, JSON, etc).
- Knowledge of Virtualisation platforms, such as VMware, OpenShift etc.
- Prior experience in AWS, Azure, and/or Google cloud services.
- Knowledge of emerging technologies, digital, cyber security, and IT industry market trends.
- Highly experienced user of MS Project and MS Office toolset (Word, Excel and Power Point); and
- Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, and experience in dealing with complex situations.

**What we can offer you**

At NSWPF our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. Some of the benefits available when you join the NSWPF include:

- competitive salary;
- flexible work options;
- annual leave loading;
- corporate wellbeing programs including seminars and the Fitness Passport;
- free annual influenza vaccination;
- salary packaging options via superannuation contributions or a novated vehicle lease;
- convenient location for public transport and to shops etc; and
- in-house gym facilities.

**How to Apply**

Applications can only be submitted electronically via the I Work for NSW website.

To be considered for this role, attach a cover letter (2 pages maximum) and an up-to-date resume that clearly details your skills & experience as relevant to this role.

Please do not attach copies of qualifications, certificates or documentation (other than what has been requested) - you can bring these if called for interview.

Please address each of the following Target Questions (600 word limit per question) in the text boxes provided in the online application or attach as a separate document.

Target Question 1:

Describe your approach architecting a solution in a large and complex environment. What factors will you consider, including dependencies and other considerations that may impact successful delivery of the project. Please describe high level architecture of the solution that was provided on the migration project. What challenges you faced in the design and implementation of the solution including any security challenge you encountered and the steps you implemented to address it.

Target Question 2

Provide details of any recent cloud migration project you were involved in? Describe your role as an individual on the project and key deliverables you produced as Solution Architect. Please ensure this is a personal experience, not generated via ChatGPT or AI tools, as firsthand experience detail will be queried during the interview process.

Your application must stand on its own merits, and the completeness and relevance of your application will determine if you proceed through to the selection process.

If you require any further information about this opportunity, please contact the hiring manager **Mani Maniruzzaman via (02) 8835 9498.**

To be eligible to apply for this role, you must meet one of the following statuses:

- an Australian Citizen;
- a permanent resident of Australia; or
- a New Zealand citizen.

Prior to commencement, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a rigorous National Police (criminal history) Check and obtain and maintain a Security Clearance as determined by the NSW Police Force.

**Our commitment to Diversity:**

The NSW Police Force is a proud employer of a diverse range of people. We are committed to reflecting the diverse community we serve and creating an inclusive and respectful workplace for all employees. Differences are embraced, contributions are valued, and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging.

We welcome people with diverse skills, experiences, perspectives and backgrounds and encourage applications from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander peoples, and individuals who may identify as LGBTIQ, with disability, a culturally and linguistically diverse background, and people of all ages.

If you identify as a person with disability and require further information on the role or you require specific arrangements to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the HR Diversity Team by email at [PCC-INCLUSION@police.nsw.gov.au](mailto:INCLUSIONDIVERSITY@police.nsw.gov.au).

If you identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and would like assistance with your application, please contact the NSWPF Aboriginal Employment & Engagement team at [PCC-AEET@police.nsw.gov.au](mailto:hraboriginal@police.nsw.gov.au).

This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months.

For more information on applying for roles with the NSW Police Force [click here](https://www.police.nsw.gov.au/recruitment_links/civilian_employees)

Thank you for your interest in this role. We look forward to receiving your application.

postTitle: Electrical Project Sales Engineer and Estimator
debugText:
**About us**

VASS Electrical Industries is the Australian specialist and market leader in Busway power distribution solutions since 1958. VASS occupies a purpose-build facility located in Ingleburn, Sydney.

VASS was recently acquired by Legrand, the global specialist in electrical and digital building infrastructures and a leader in Australia and New Zealand for many decades. Legrand has built a strong infrastructure of sales, service, manufacturing, R&D and logistics across both the countries. Every day, over 450 motivated employees work hard to enhance the buildings of tomorrow and make them more sustainable for everyone. This makes VASS a perfect place to learn, grow and build brilliant careers.

**About the Opportunity**

Are you an experienced professional with a passion for electrical power distribution systems? We are seeking a dynamic and skilled Electrical Project Sales Engineer and Estimator to join our team. In this role, you will be at the forefront of customer relations, technical support, quotations, and project coordination, driving business growth across diverse sectors. This role will be reporting to the CEO.

**Key responsibilities:**

- review, respond, and prepare requests for quotations for both local and international customers
- provide product and technical support, offering expert advice to our customer base
- promote and provide application solutions utilising our Electrical Power Distribution Systems
- establish and nurture new business relationships across all market sectors
- manage and coordinate projects between customers and our engineering/manufacturing departments
- ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget

**To be successful in this role you will have:**

- Electrical Tertiary qualification or Electrical Trade Background
- ability to interpret electrical drawings, schematics, architectural drawings, and engineering specifications
- computer literacy in MS Office software (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint) and Aconex
- excellent written and verbal communication skills
- strong negotiation skills at senior account levels

**What %%U+0027%% s on Offer**

- an engaging and supportive work environment
- opportunities for professional growth and development
- a chance to be part of a period of significant growth and transformation
- access to amazing benefits and a great work environment
- an extensive reward and recognition program
- free on-site parking

We recognise that in real life, great people don %%U+0027%% t always  %%U+0027%% tick all the boxes %%U+0027%% . That %%U+0027%% s why we hire for potential as well as experience. Even if you don %%U+0027%% t meet every point on the role description, if this role and our company feels like a good fit for you, we still want to hear from you.

postTitle: Full Stack Web Developer Intern (University Student)
debugText:
**Job title:**

Full Stack Web Developer Intern (University Student)

**COMPANY DESCRPTION:**

HA TECH is an Australian based Biotechnology company dedicated to research and development of innovative Diagnostic Products, Biopharmaceuticals and Medical Technologies. The company has a diagnostic manufacturing facility at Castle Hill, and Kings Park Sydney, Australia. Manufacturing capacity of 40 million RT PCR tests/month and capacity of 10 million Antigen tests/month. Winner of 2022 NSW Premier Export Award.

Our team is seeking a highly motivated university student with a passion for full stack web development to join us for a short-term project. This is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in both frontend and backend development, working closely with our research team to ensure the development of our web application aligns with project requirements.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

As a Full Stack Web Developer, you will work on a web application project focused on delivering comprehensive frontend and backend development. You will be involved in all stages of development, from building and refining user interfaces to integrating backend APIs, with a focus on maintaining performance and scalability. This is a great opportunity for a student to gain valuable experience in a professional environment. Your responsibilities will include:

- Assist in building and maintaining frontend applications using modern frameworks and libraries (React, TypeScript, Vite).
- Develop backend solutions, focusing on REST API integration and serverless architecture using AWS Lambda.
- Work with state management tools such as Redux, including redux-thunk and redux-persist, to manage application data flow.
- Implement authentication and authorization features, including role-based access control (RBAC).
- Collaborate with the development team to ensure smooth integration between frontend and backend systems.
- Debug, troubleshoot, and optimise existing codebases for better performance and scalability.

**Note: Other duties may be assigned**

**ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE**

- Currently enrolled in a university program related to computer science, software engineering, or a similar discipline.
- Strong foundational knowledge of frontend technologies (React, JavaScript/TypeScript).
- Familiarity with backend technologies such as REST APIs and cloud services (AWS Lambda preferred).
- Basic understanding of state management (Redux) and how to handle async actions.
- Some experience with tools for building and bundling frontend applications (Vite or similar).
- Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively in a remote environment.

**DESIRABLE FOR THE ROLE**

- Experience with AWS services, particularly AWS Amplify for authentication and API management.
- Familiarity with Axios for API requests and handling errors gracefully.
- Understanding of role-based access control and security best practices in web development.
- Knowledge of testing and debugging tools like Jest or similar.

debugText:
We are looking for a **Mid to Senior Java/Scala Developer** with strong foundational knowledge in computer science and experience with distributed systems, particularly **Apache Spark**. The ideal candidate will also have expertise in open-source table formats like **Apache Iceberg**, **Delta Lake**, **Apache Hudi**, and experience with open Lakehouse architecture, including **Unity Catalog**, **Polaris Catalog**, and **MLflow**. While mid to senior-level developers are preferred, we welcome applications from fresh graduates with a Master’s degree in a relevant field.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- **Software Development**: Design, develop, and optimise distributed applications using **Java** and **Scala** to support large-scale data processing and analytics.
- **Apache Spark Expertise**: Utilise deep knowledge of **Apache Spark** internals to build and optimise efficient data pipelines, ensuring performance and scalability.
- **Table Formats**: Work with open-source table formats like **Apache Iceberg**, **Delta Lake**, **Apache Hudi**, and **Apache Xtable** to manage and process large data sets effectively.
- **Lakehouse Architecture**: Implement open Lakehouse solutions, including cataloging systems like **Unity Catalog** and **Polaris Catalog**, and manage ML workflows with **MLflow**.
- **Computer Science Fundamentals**: Apply a solid understanding of data structures, caching mechanisms, networking, and database management to build efficient systems.
- **Collaboration**: Work closely with data engineers, machine learning engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate solutions that meet business requirements.

**Key Requirements:**

- **Experience**: Mid to senior-level experience (3+ years) in **Java** or **Scala** development. Fresh graduates with a Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field are also encouraged to apply.
- **Computer Science Knowledge**: Strong understanding of core concepts such as **data structures**, caching strategies, networking, and database systems.
- **Apache Spark**: In-depth knowledge of **Apache Spark** internals, including job execution, query optimisation, and distributed data processing.
- **Open Source Table Formats**: Hands-on experience with **Apache Iceberg**, **Delta Lake**, **Apache Hudi**, or **Apache Xtable**.
- **Open Lakehouse & MLflow**: Familiarity with open Lakehouse architecture tools such as **Unity Catalog**, **Polaris Catalog**, and **MLflow** for data management and machine learning integration.
- **Problem-Solving**: Ability to identify, troubleshoot, and solve complex issues in large-scale distributed systems.

debugText:
_**Engineer the future. Start your dream career with Dematic today!**_

**WHAT IS SO AMAZING ABOUT THIS OPPORTUNITY**

Are you ready to create industry-leading software solutions that interface with cutting-edge **equipment, machinery, hardware, and robotics**? We have an exciting opportunity for a **Software Engineer** to join our Global Product and Solutions team, based in Belrose.

In this role, you’ll work with a talented team of engineers, developing high-quality software for impactful **warehouse automation projects**. You %%U+0027%% ll be more than just a coder—your solutions will come to life as you see them operating in real-time and engage with clients directly during site commissioning. Your work will play a pivotal role in transforming industries such as eCommerce, retail, manufacturing, exporting, parcel services, and more.

As a leading logistics systems integrator, Dematic delivers sophisticated, end-to-end warehouse solutions that combine advanced materials handling and storage systems with state-of-the-art software. Join us and be part of a team that %%U+0027%% s continually enhancing global supply chains with innovative technology.

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS ROLE:**

- You’ll work on significant, hands-on projects, where your solutions have an immediate impact
- You’ll collaborate with a passionate team of engineers committed to driving innovation
- You’ll travel across the Asia-Pacific region, supporting key clients and seeing your work in action
- Your contributions will shape global project engineering and be a part of ground-breaking warehouse technologies used around the world.

**WHAT YOUR PROJECTS LOOKS LIKE**

- **Collaborative team-based Developers** working on projects encompassing software, configuration, documentation, customer communication and support.
- **Projects are implemented from start to finish**, with developers performing the on-site commissioning. Projects will start in the office, before final implementation and delivery on customer sites.
- “ **Goldilocks” balance** – just the right amount of travel to keep things exciting without it being excessively frequent, a software level that’s engaging to work on without being overly device level or overly abstract, and a friendly team size for collaboration. Projects conclude with delivering “real” physical systems with moving automation, not just an application.
- **Full stack development** on a tech stack consisting of backend modules utilizing C# and SQL + configuration based building blocks. C# full application GUIs, and Blazor based web. Mixture of legacy + new development tech. Control industrial hardware devices from a logical level.

**WHAT YOU WILL BE WORKING ON**

- Developing software products to required specifications
- Developing technical documents, including specifications and reports
- Delivering software projects to customer sites
- Participating in on site systems commissioning
- Test implemented solution to ensure contractual agreements are met
- Participating in design, code reviews and code documentation
- Providing assistance to the Software Service group for customer support acting as high tier support
- Perform in place upgrades to legacy/existing sites
- Interacting directly with customers via email and in person
- Providing IT, networking, and application support and configuration for customer sites
- Providing product expertise to support the sales process
- Agreeing on time schedules with Team Leaders and achieving specified targets of multiple projects in parallel
- Following Software Development Quality Processes and procedures
- Actively contributing to the improvement of Software Development processes
- Contributing to a Software Development environment that fosters technical excellence and teamwork

**SETTING YOU UP FOR SUCCESS**

- Degree in Software Engineering/Mechatronics or similar
- We will consider applications from recent
**Honour Graduates**
- Experience with networking, monitoring, diagnosis and trouble shooting

**Preferred Experience** in software languages and tools including Microsoft products:

- .NET, C# (including Blazor, ASP.NET, WPF  WinForms
- Skilled in modern technologies and languages
- OO design/development
- MS Windows programming experience
- Relational databases
- Excellent Testing skills
- Understanding of modern software development methodologies

**Highly Desirable**:

- hardware/electronics/equipment/controls experience/hobby
- Languages/platforms/DB: .NET/C#, Java/J2EE, Delphi XE, SQL Server, Windows Server
- Tech.: XML/XSL/CSS, http, SOA, WinForms, WPF, WCF, HTML5, JavaScript
- Modelling tools, e.g.: UML
- Development for mobile devices
- Multithreading
- Comms (TCPIP, http, https, etc.)

**Desirable**:

- Experience in Radio Frequency technologies
- Logistics & Material Handling or Manufacturing industries
- VMware/HyperV
- Server/DB configurations
- Middleware (Biztalk Server, WebSphere, etc.)

**WHAT WE OFFER YOU**

- Local and International travel
- Project based work
- Exposure to a wide range of technologies and processes, excellent experience in practical software engineering skills, SQL Database and infrastructure, IT infrastructure, and engineering
- Progressive and innovative global company experiencing high growth
- Career Development and Global Opportunities
- Competitive salary, with salary packaging and novated leasing available
- Corporate discounts on car rentals and IT products/accessories
- Paid Parental Leave + super: 12 weeks for primary carer/2 weeks secondary
- Purchase Leave
- Study Assistance
- Social Club
- Employee Referral Programme

**WHY BRING YOUR CAREER TO DEMATIC**

This is an exciting time to join Dematic. We are proud to design, build, implement, and support automated system solutions for warehouses, distribution centres, and production facilities. We live on the cutting edge of technology and industry and are a global leader with 11,000 employees worldwide and over 700 employees in Australia and New Zealand.

**HOW TO APPLY**

If you would like to apply for the above position, please click on the ‘ _**Apply for this job’**_ button and submit your resume. For more information on Dematic:
_www.dematic.com_

_Dematic is committed to proving equal employment opportunity in all areas of employment including recruitment, selection, promotion, training etc. and in accordance with federal and state legislation, Dematic Pty Ltd (Dematic or the Company) promotes a workplace free from discrimination and harassment._

**The role**

The **Principal Solution Architect** works closely with a team of Solution Architects to create technology solutions that align with enterprise standards and roadmaps. This role involves developing capability models, analysing solution options, and collaborating with technology teams to document and implement end-to-end solution designs on schedule.

As the Principal Solution Architect, your key responsibilities will include defining solutions that meet business demands and align with enterprise architecture, working with service providers to ensure IT solutions deliver business benefits, and managing service level agreements. You will be responsible for interpreting business requirements, informing strategic technology investments, and ensuring solutions are implemented as expected. In this role, you will be challenged with balancing project interdependencies, developing tailored solutions to align with various architectures, and staying current with industry best practices.

For more information read the full Role Description:
[**Principal** **Solution Architect**](https://www.dpie.nsw.gov.au/?a=621184)

**What you will bring to the role**

- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively present ideas and communicate with stakeholders and teammates
- Strong problem-solving abilities to navigate complex challenges, adapt to evolving situations and deliver to tight deadlines
- Strong teamwork and collaboration skills, with a willingness to contribute to group efforts and support colleagues in achieving objectives and adopting new knowledge
- Outstanding stakeholder engagement skills, fostering strong relationships and ensuring alignment with diverse stakeholders to achieve outcomes
- Capable of driving outcomes while effectively involving stakeholders throughout the process to foster collaboration and buy-in.

**What is an essential requirement:**

- Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline and/or equivalent relevant experience

**About us**

The [Department of Planning, Housing and Infrastructure](https://www.nsw.gov.au/departments-and-agencies/department-of-planning-housing-and-infrastructure)
(DPHI) improves the liveability and prosperity of NSW. To achieve this, we: create vibrant, productive spaces and precincts; manage lands, assets and property effectively and deliver affordable and diverse housing. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and builds the cultural capability of our department to improve outcomes with and for Aboriginal people, communities and entities.

We are an inclusive and accessible workplace, where your individual contributions are valued, and where everyone is encouraged to feel a sense of connection and belonging. DPHI supports various employee affinity groups, practices flexible working, offers job share and workplace adjustments.

**Join us**

If excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the role.

Applications close **Monday 28th October at 11.55pm.**

Should you require further information about the role please contact Prajwal Subedi on [prajwal.subedi@environment.nsw.gov.au](mailto:prajwal.subedi@environment.nsw.gov.au).

_A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type that may become available over the next 18 months._

Please note to be eligible to apply for this position you must be an Australian or New Zealand citizen or permanent resident, or hold a valid Australian working Visa for the duration of the appointment.

We encourage and support applications from people with disability. Please reach out to us to discuss any [accommodations or adjustments](https://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au/adjustments-for-individual-needs) that may be needed during the recruitment process, ensuring that you have every opportunity to showcase your talent, skills, and potential. Contact the Talent Team via [talent.acquisition@dpie.nsw.gov.au](mailto:talent.acquisition@dpie.nsw.gov.au) or (02) 63637676​ - HR Support, option 3, DPHI People Advisory, option 1 and reference  %%U+0027%% Request an Adjustment - Job Title and Reference Number %%U+0027%% .

Check out our
[Aboriginal applicants guide](https://www.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/files/2024-05/dphi-working-with-us-guide-for-aboriginal-applicants.pdf)
to assist with applying for the role or contact our
[Aboriginal Career pathways](https://nswdpie.tfaforms.net/1025)
team for a yarn.

debugText:
At RØDE Microphones we are Passionate about Audio

Want to work for one of the fastest-growing, most innovative manufacturer-exporters in audio technology in the world today? RØDE is looking for passionate, talented and dedicated open-source UI software developer to join our rapidly-growing team.

Part of The Freedman Group, RØDE is a leading manufacturer of high-quality microphones and audio equipment, which can be found in studios, venues, on-location, and in the hands of creatives in every corner of the world. Our products are designed and primarily manufactured by our industry-leading team in Sydney and are exported to over 119 countries globally through more than 6000 dealers, including Amazon, Best Buy, Sweetwater, Guitar Center, Thomann and JB Hi-Fi. Our employees are passionate, hard working, talented and are pivotal to our success.

Your responsibilities will include:

- Develop and maintain a series of software companion applications that operate alongside RØDE hardware products.
- Implement efficient and concise GUI code, in order to realise user interface designs provided by the UI/UX team.
- Collaborate with a diverse team of firmware, electronics and software engineers, to collate dependencies and requirements for the companion application(s)
- Deliver prototypes and final implementations,
 in a fast paced product development environment
- Ensuring all projects uphold a high standard of functional and technical performance – in line with the RØDE brand
- Manage inputs from key stakeholders and collaborators
- Report to the software architect and team leaders
- Be willing to mentor junior application developers and contribute to building a wider GUI focussed application development team

You will require the following skills and experience to be successful:

- Proven experience in FLUTTER (or similar DART based language).
 Solid understanding of object orientated software and graphical user interface design/implementation
- Mid-level proficiency in the following languages: C++, Python and/or other scripting languages
- Past experience developing cross platform applications and GUIs
- Experience with IOS, ANDROID, WINDOWS and/or MAC development environments and deployment pipelines.
- Past experience with source control tools such as GIT is mandatory.
- Meticulous attention to detail and process-orientated approach
- Self-disciplined team player, able to work in multi-disciplinary team environment
- Good written and verbal communication to all internal and external stakeholders

You would benefit from having the following skills and experience:

- Expert level of knowledge in DART and/or FLUTTER.
- Past experience developing using JNI on ANDROID.
- Past experience with C++ libraries such as JUCE.

**Systems Development Engineer**

 Our client is a forward-thinking telecommunications company known for its innovative solutions and commitment to excellence in the industry. They are dedicated to revolutionising connectivity through advanced technologies and exceptional service. With a collaborative culture and a focus on professional development, our client is looking for passionate individuals to join their dynamic team.

**Position Overview:** We are seeking an exceptional Systems Development Engineer with expertise in software development, system administration, and cloud computing. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining complex systems, applications, and infrastructure on Amazon Web Services (AWS). This role requires a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- Design, develop, deploy, and maintain scalable cloud-based systems on AWS, including EC2 instances, RDS databases, S3 buckets, and more.
- Develop software applications using various programming languages (e.g., Python, Node.js, Java).
- Manage and maintain all aspects of hardware, software, and operating systems, including patching, updating, and troubleshooting.
- Ensure the security and integrity of our production environment by implementing and enforcing security best practices.
- Collaborate with internal and external teams to ensure smooth operation of production environments and troubleshoot complex technical issues.
- Develop and maintain documentation for systems, applications, and infrastructure, including architecture diagrams, deployment guides, and user manuals.
- Troubleshoot complex technical issues in a fast-paced environment and provide on-call support as needed.
- Participate in code reviews, contribute to the development of coding standards, and promote best practices for software development.
- Work closely with various teams to automate tasks, improve efficiency, and reduce manual labour.

**Requirements:**

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
- 3+ years of experience in software development, system administration, and cloud computing.
- Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), including:
  - EC2 instances
  - RDS databases
  - S3 buckets
  - Elastic Load Balancers (ELBs)
  - API Gateway
  - Lambda
- Strong programming skills in one or more languages, such as Java, Python, C++, or Node.js.
- Experience with software development methodologies like Agile and DevOps.
- Strong understanding of system administration principles, including security, backup and recovery, and disaster recovery planning.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

- Experience with cloud security, compliance, and governance frameworks.
- Knowledge of containerisation tools like Docker.
- Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools like Jenkins or GitLab CI/CD.
- Strong experience with Linux and/or Windows operating systems.

**Why Work With Us?**

Joining our client means becoming part of a vibrant team that values creativity, collaboration, and innovation. You will have the opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects that shape the future of telecommunications. Our client is committed to your professional development and offers a supportive environment where your contributions truly matter.

**Conditions:**

- This is a full-time, permanent position with flexible working options available.
- Competitive salary commensurate with experience and qualifications, alongside a comprehensive benefits package.

 If you %%U+0027%% re ready to take the next step in your career and make a meaningful impact in the telecommunications industry, we invite you to apply!

 Please send your resume to **Courtney@rubixsolutions.net.au** or call **0481 606 007** if you have any questions.

**Our client is an equal opportunity employer. They celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, fostering a culture where everyone feels valued and respected.**
